message_1: Find the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 9)/(x - 3) as x approaches 3.
message_2:
To find the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 9)/(x - 3) as x approaches 3, we can first try to simplify the function. We can factor the numerator:

x^2 - 9 = (x - 3)(x + 3)

Now the function becomes:

f(x) = ((x - 3)(x + 3))/(x - 3)

We can cancel out the (x - 3) terms:

f(x) = x + 3

Now, we can find the limit as x approaches 3:

lim (x -> 3) (x + 3) = 3 + 3 = 6

So, the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 9)/(x - 3) as x approaches 3 is 6.
